title.narrative: Climate Adaptation and Mitigation Program for Aral Sea Basin CAMP4ASB

description.narrative: To enhance regionally coordinated access to improved climate change knowledge services for key stakeholders (e.g., policy makers, communities, and civil society) in participating Central Asian countries, as well as to increased investments and capacity building that, combined, will address climate challenges common to these countries.

participating-org.narrative: Executive Committee for International Fund for Saving the Aral Sea
Ministry of Finance of the Republic of Tajikistan
Ministry of Finance of the Republic of Uzbekistan

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Implementation Arrangements, Schedule 2, Section I.A. of the FA (TJ) | Description :The Recipient shall (a)cause the Technical Working Group and the NCU to coordinate and collaborate with EC-IFAS and RCU for implementation of Component 1, in accordance with the provisions set forth in the Project Operational Manual; and (b) afford all reasonable opportunity forrepresentatives of EC-IFAS and RCU to visit any part of its territory for purposes related to Component 1. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Implementation Arrangements, Schedule 2, Section I.A. of the FA (TJ) | Description :The Recipient shall carryout Subcomponents 2.1 and 2.2 through MOF PMU, and 3.2 through MOF PMU and CEP, as per requirements, criteria, organizationalarrangements and operational procedures of the Project and Line of Credit Operational Manuals and Environmental ManagementFramework, and shall not assign, amend, abrogate or waive any of their provisions, without the Association's prior approval.

Finance Agreement :Implementation Arrangements, Schedule 2, Section I.A. of the FA (TJ) | Description :The Recipient shall causeMOF-PMU to contract a credit specialist to assist PFIs with execution of Subcomponent 2.1; sign the contract for installation andadaptation of the accounting software acceptable to the Association for Project accounting, budgeting and reporting; and makeprovisions for adequate training on the new accounting system for the effective use by its FM staff and consultants. | Due Date:12-Jun-2016

Finance Agreement :Implementation Arrangements, Schedule 2, Section I.A. of the FA (TJ) | Description :The Recipient shall maintainthe Technical Working Group, throughout the life of the Project in accordance with the provisions set forth in the ProjectOperational Manual. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Implementation Arrangements, Schedule 2, Section I.A. of the FA (TJ) | Description :The Recipient shall, inconsultation with the stakeholders and the potential Project Beneficiaries, establish and maintain a Grievance Redress Mechanism,in accordance with procedures and guidelines set forth in the POM, and acceptable to the Association. | Due Date :27-Aug-2016

Finance Agreement :Implementation Arrangements, Schedule 2, Section I.A. of the FA (TJ) | Description :The Recipient shallestablish the NCU under CEP (within 45 days from effectiveness), maintain the NCU and the MOF PMU until Project completion, andensure these units are adequately staffed by personnel and consultants with skills and under terms of reference and functionsalways in accordance with procedures necessary and appropriate for Project implementation and acceptable to the Association. |Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Implementation Arrangements, Schedule 2, Section I.A. of the FA (UZ) | Description :For implementation ofSubcomponent 2.2, the Recipient, through the RRA, shall select Facilitating Organizations based on the criteria set forth in theProject Operational Manual; and execute a contract with each Facilitating Organization for carrying out the activities underSubcomponent 2.2, and such contracts shall contain terms and conditions satisfactory to the Association. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Implementation Arrangements, Schedule 2, Section I.A. of the FA (UZ) | Description :For the purposes of carryingout Subcomponent 2.1 of the Project, the Recipient, through RRA, shall select eligible PFIs in accordance with the criteria andprocedures set forth in the Line of Credit Operational Manual and on terms and conditions referred to in the Financing Agreement. |Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Implementation Arrangements, Schedule 2, Section I.A. of the FA (UZ) | Description :No later than 30 days fromthe Effective Date, the Recipient shall cause RRA to sign a contract for retention of a credit specialist to assist PFIs withexecution of Subcomponent 2.1 of the Project. | Due Date :

Finance Agreement :Implementation Arrangements, Schedule 2, Section I.A. of the FA (UZ) | Description :The Recipient shall (a)cause the established focal point or group, and the NCU to coordinate and collaborate with EC-IFAS, RCU for implementation ofComponent 1 of the Project, in accordance with the Project Operational Manual; and (b) afford all reasonable opportunity forrepresentatives of EC-IFAS and RCU to visit any part of its territory for purposes related to Component 1 of the Project. |Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Implementation Arrangements, Schedule 2, Section I.A. of the FA (UZ) | Description :The Recipient shall carryout Component 2 and Subcomponent 3.2 through RRA, as per requirements, criteria, organizational arrangements and operationalprocedures set forth in the Project and Line of Credit Operational Manual and the Environmental Management Framework, and shall notassign, amend, abrogate or waive any provisions of these documents, without prior approval of the Association. | Frequency:CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Implementation Arrangements, Schedule 2, Section I.A. of the FA (UZ) | Description :The Recipient shall causethe RRA, within 30 days of the Effective Date, to (a) sign a contract for adaptation of the accounting software acceptable to theAssociation for Project accounting, budgeting and reporting; and (b) make provisions for adequate training on the new accountingsystem for the effective use by its accounting staff and the financial management consultant. | Due Date :

Finance Agreement :Implementation Arrangements, Schedule 2, Section I.A. of the FA (UZ) | Description :The Recipient shall ensurethat RRA’s financial and accounting unit carries out the financial management and disbursement functions related to Subcomponent2.2 and 3.2 of the Project. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Implementation Arrangements, Schedule 2, Section I.A. of the FA (UZ) | Description :The Recipient shall maintainthe NCU within RRA throughout the duration of the Project and shall ensure that the NCU is adequately staffed by personnel andconsultants with qualifications and under terms of reference and functions, at all times in accordance withprocedures necessary andappropriate for the carrying out of the Project. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Implementation Arrangements, Schedule 2, Section I.A. of the FA (UZ) | Description :The Recipient shall, inconsultation with the stakeholders and the potential Project Beneficiaries, establish and maintain a Grievance Redress Mechanism,in accordance with procedures and guidelines set forth in the POM, and acceptable to the Association. | Due Date :

Finance Agreement :Implementation Arrangements, Schedule 2, Section I.A. of the FA (UZ) | Description :The Recipient shallestablish a focal point or focal group for coordination and collaboration with EC-IFAS, RCU, NCU and/or the Steering Committee forimplementation of Component 1, and supporting inter-agency dialogue and regional coordination of Subcomponents 2.1 and 3.2, untilProject completion, in accordance with the POM's provisions. | Due Date :

Finance Agreement :Implementation Arrangements, Schedule 2, Section I.C.1 of the FA (TJ) | Description :For the purposes ofcarrying out Subcomponent 2.1 of the Project, the Recipient, through MOF PMU, shall select eligible PFIs in accordance with thecriteria and procedures set forth in the Line of Credit Operational Manual and on terms and conditions referred to in the FinancingAgreement. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Implementation Arrangements, Schedule 2, Section I.C.1 of the FA (TJ) | Description :The Recipient shall makeSubsidiary Loans to eligible PFIs under Subsidiary Loan Agreements to be entered into between the Recipient and each eligible PFI.Eept as the Association shall otherwise agree, the Recipient shall not assign, amend, abrogate or waive the Subsidiary LoanAgreement or any of its provisions. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Implementation Arrangements, Schedule 2, Section I.C.1 of the FA (UZ) | Description :The Recipient shall makeSubsidiary Loans to eligible PFIs under Subsidiary Loan Agreements to be entered into between the Recipient and each eligible PFI.Eept as the Association shall otherwise agree, the Recipient shall not assign, amend, abrogate or waive the Subsidiary LoanAgreement or any of its provisions. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Institutional Arrangements, Schedule 2, Section I.A. of the FA (EC-IFAS) | Description :The Recipient shallcarry out Component 1 and Subcomponent 3.1 of the Project in accordance with the requirements, criteria, organizationalarrangements and operational procedures set forth in the Project Operational Manual and the Environmental Management Framework, andshall not assign, amend, abrogate or waive any provisions of these two documents without prior approval of the Association. |Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Institutional Arrangements, Schedule 2, Section I.A. of the FA (EC-IFAS) | Description :The Recipient shallcontract two technical specialists, to assist the Recipient in carrying out the oversight, inter-agency coordination and policyguidance of the regional activities of the Project. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Institutional Arrangements, Schedule 2, Section I.A. of the FA (EC-IFAS) | Description :Within 60 days of theEffective Date, the Recipient shall establish and thereafter maintain a Steering Committee to provide strategic guidance forProject implementation. The mechanism and structure of the Steering Committee will be to be documented in the Project OperationalManual. | Due Date :27-Jun-2016

Finance Agreement :Institutional Arrangements, Schedule 2, Section I.A. of the FA (TJ) | Description :For the implementation ofSubcomponent 2.2, the Recipient, through the MOF PMU, shall select Facilitating Organizations based on the criteria set forth inthe Project Operational Manual and execute a contract with each Facilitating Organization for carrying out the activities underSubcomponent 2.2, and such contracts shall contain terms and conditions satisfactory to the Association. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Institutional Arrangements, Schedule 2, Section I.A. of the FA (TJ) | Description :The Recipient shall ensurethat CEP’s and MOF PMU's financial and accounting units carry out the financial management and disbursement functions related toSubcomponent 3.2 of the Project, and that MOF PMU’s financial and accounting unit carries out the financial management anddisbursement functions related to Subcomponents 2.1 and 2.2 of the Project. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Safeguards, Schedule 2, Section D of the FA (TJ) | Description :The Recipient shall ensure that the Project isimplemented in accordance with applicable environmental and social standards and practices and in compliance with applicable lawsand regulations on child and forced labor. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Safeguards, Schedule 2, Section D of the FA (UZ) | Description :The Recipient shall ensure that the Project isimplemented in accordance with applicable environmental and social standards and practices and in compliance with applicable lawsand regulations on child and forced labor. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

title.narrative: Number of users of public climate data and analytical services provided by the platform
Beneficiaries that feel project investments reflected their needs
Feedback/Grievances responded and/or resolved within the stipulated service standards for response times
Improved understanding of gender-specific implications of climate change among key stakeholders and implementation of key activities
Number of hectares in project area covered by effective agricultural, land, and water management practices suited to local agro-ecological conditions, which can address climate change
Number of country-led plans and programs that draw on Program’s climate knowledge services, including lessons from climate investments
Cooperative action resulting in the financing of investments that require collaboration across countries (e.g., transboundary investment or multi-country coordination of national policies)
Number of multi-country climate coordination networks supported under Program, enabling intra-governmental, sectoral, NGO, etc. cooperation
Additional resources mobilized for knowledge, capacity, and investment for regional climate/green action through increased Program coordination among Central Asian countries and development community
Proportion of users reporting satisfaction with Climate Knowledge Services provided by Program
Female beneficiaries reached with financial services
